column4: so nothing apart from failed cd integrity test that could be the cause for install hanging up at 75% ?
you removed quiet and splash from boot parameters to see the exact errors yet?
I am using alternate cd - and no
ah the alternate cd; then there is no splash--you check iso against md5
yes
this a dual boot or only ubuntu
only xubuntu
what are the system specs
pretty bad - 500mhz p3 and 64mb ram
it is the ram most likely--you might try fluxbuntu
hmm, wouldn't that give me an error message before trying to install?
no real idea; just a guess on my part; 64mb is pretty slim in the ram department
yeah
they co-exist
yes, thank I know, I was wondering if there was a package that replaces 3.0 instead of me having to do it manually
you need to keep 3 installed when installing 3.5
why, exactly?
see the link above?

I stumbled across that, when I googled, I was just wondering why something like this can not be a end-user choice - upgrading 9.04 to karmic (isn't that unstable?) because I want to use a newer version of my browser seems kind of strange, for the lack of a better word
from the repos? using the package manager? no.
3.5 is in the repos for jaunty. and is final.
